body.p:
Winchester Sept 9th 1861
Govr Magoffin
Dr Sir,

I wrote you some weeks since in reference to a couple of Judgts for the amount of which Mr James H. Ogden of this place stands bound. I learn from him that the letter did not reach you. The Judgts were rendered in the Clark Court for Gaming against Samuel Combs Jr. Combs Repleived them with Ogden as his security and did the week afterwards without property. Ogden is a young man with a large family to support, poor and Respectable. In the condition of the time it will him to meet the Bonds which are now done. He went upon the Bonds, to save Combs who was very young, And if the latter had lived, I have no doubt he would have met the payment promptly. If your Excellency could releive Mr Ogden from the payment of these Judgts it would much oblige
